New Records: Houston Astros clinched their fourth consecutive AL West title with the win.
Jason Heyward hit a go-ahead, two-run homer and made a leaping defensive catch to rob a base runner.
Alex Bregman hit his first home run of the season in the first inning.
Kyle Tucker hit a solo home run in the fourth inning.
Key Match Events: Jason Heyward's two-run homer in the fifth inning was the turning point of the game.
Josh Hader pitched a strong ninth inning, striking out the last two Mariners batters to secure the save.
Jorge Polanco had a season-high four hits and two RBI for the Mariners.
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada expressed emotional pride after the win, highlighting the team's resilience.
Seattle Mariners manager Dan Wilson emphasized the importance of continuing the fight for the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Minute Maid Park in Houston, Texas, with an attendance of 38,195.
The game ended in 2 hours and 26 minutes.
